title: Reebok Mens Energen Lux
Customer_say: Customers find these shoes comfortable, lightweight, and true to size, with good looks and value for money. They appreciate the fit, with one customer noting they're not too wide or narrow. The durability receives mixed feedback - while some customers report great durability, others mention that the soles wear out fast.

Review.review: I've been wearing the Reebok Energen Lux shoes for over a month, and I'm genuinely impressed by their performance as an all-day, every-day shoe. I needed something that could handle both short gym sessions and constant wear—from morning errands to evening walks—and these have quickly become my go-to pair.What truly stands out is the enduring support. Many comfortable shoes feel great on day one but start to flatten out after a couple of weeks. These Energen Lux shoes have successfully retained their cushion and responsiveness, even with continuous daily use. The mid-sole provides a fantastic blend of softness for comfort and firmness for stability, which is essential for keeping feet and joints happy when you're on your feet for hours.The fit is true to size, and the upper mesh material is breathable without feeling flimsy. The construction is solid, showing no premature signs of wear on the sole or the upper fabric, which speaks volumes about their quality at this price point.If you are looking for a highly versatile, comfortable, and reliable sneaker that can transition effortlessly from a light workout shoe to a shoe you wear daily without losing its supportive feel, I highly recommend the Reebok Energen Lux. Fantastic value and performance.
Nice, comfortable and affordable pair of sneakers, bought on sale, and it was a great purchaseDurabililty has been great so far
Excellent productThe sneakers exceeded my expectations. They're comfortable, good quality, and the design is exactly as described. Highly recommended.

Super easy to clean to keep nice and white(washing machine with bleach let air dry). The material on the shoes has held up through several washes. Nice shoe for any need.

So I am only 20 miles in but:My first impression is that these make for a great daily trainer if you can compromise on the build of the uppers.Reebok did a beautiful job with heel and forefoot cushioning in the lowers and the outsole is very durable. BUT! They compromised on the uppers with making them under padded and somewhat stiff around the ankle and tongue.I would like to add that they run narrow in the midfoot but have ample room in the toe box. I have purchased wide shoes in brands like HOKA but these seem to run wide. Also, the cushioning is responsive and give good push off unlike the foam in shoes like the HOKA Clifton (which for me felt like running on a marshmallow).Overall, solid shoe 20 miles in and hope to get a couple Hundy out them.

I love these tennis shoes. I was introduced to Brooks tennis shoes years ago, when I worked in the medical field; I fell in LOVE with my brooks, but certainly not the price tag. I saw these advertised on Amazon when searching for a new pair of tennis shoes, and as an avid purple lover, I just had to have these! I love the color; they’re not too bright and not too dark, which means I can wear these with practically anything. I ordered these in a 6.5, since I typically wear a size 6.5-7. I will admit that they were a little tighter on the top. I’m also 8 months pregnant, so I assumed it was from water retention, because they fit perfectly on other days. Although they don’t fit like my Brooks, they’re still very comfortable! Since I’m in the final stages of my pregnancy, I still try to workout as much as I can; so far, they’ve held up pretty well! Which, for $70, they should last awhile! They’re very comfortable, durable, and lightweight, which are all very important to me when considering a shoe, especially since I practically live in them. I’ve had them for a few months now, and although I haven’t worn them enough to break them in, I have worn them enough times to give this honest review! They haven’t left any blisters, and my feet didn’t hurt while I adjusted to them. Overall, I’d rate these tennis shoes a 4/5 for comfort, support, and functionality.

title: Reebok Nano X5 Mens Shoes, Cross Training and Light Running Sneakers for Men
Customer_say: Customers find these gym shoes superior in quality, comfortable, and effective for workouts, with one customer noting they're great for leg days at the gym. The shoes receive positive feedback for their style, support, and fit. Customers disagree on the sizing, with some reporting the shoes are too small and too short.

Review.review: Solid cross trainers for people with a lifting focus. Flat sole, way less toe spring than many other cross trainers. Wider toe box as well. Result is a more stable shoe with excellent ground contact. Not anchors or lifted like a lifting shoe and excellent side grip which gives it good lateral movement as well.Overall a stylish unicorn of a shoe that meets several needs of both weightlifting and aerobic activity.Obviously this all has trade-offs. Less toe spring and wider box means not as good of a running shoe as some others. Less heel and more flexible lateral movement means not a perfect squat shoe, but this is my pick for a weight lifter focused cross trainer that wants to fit in some cardio and calisthenics in the same workout without changing shoes.
I've never worn a more comfortable gym shoe! I take them on walks and short runs too but just wearing them out for the day and in the gym feels great. They fit perfectly and look very nice!

I really love these shoes. Very lightweight with solid support. I do mostly CrossFit which means running, barbell work and gymnastics. It is perfect for workouts that involve a little bit of each. I wouldn’t do heavy squats or Olympic lifts in them but they work for lighter workouts I don’t want to wear my lifters for. I wouldn’t run a marathon with them but I prefer them if I have to run intervals while also incorporating barbell work.

This version is shorter and narrower. Ordered size 12.5 per my last X1 pair and these do not fit. Typical of Reebok to modify sizing every iteration of the Nano. Frustrating because the screaming deal I got on this pair is more than twice the price for size 13.

title: Reebok Men's Walk Ultra 7 DMX Max Walking Sneakers
Customer_say: Customers find these walking shoes comfortable, well-designed, and good value for money, with great arch support that's particularly suitable for older feet. The fit receives mixed feedback, with some finding them good while others say they're too narrow. Moreover, durability is also mixed, with some saying they're durable for walking or working while others report them falling apart. Additionally, customers note that the shoes squeak like crazy.

Review.review: Ok, these shoes are stellar; comfortable, supportive and with the dependability of genuine leather. The (Ortholite) insoles are amazing and the Moving Air technology seems to work really well. My pair fit to perfection and look splendid. That they reached me fast via the incomparable Amazon experience is just gravy, as is the surprisingly reasonable price. Dance on, Reebok.
He really liked them  said they were very comfortable.

I bought these sneakers to replace a sub-$30.00 pair of Kirkland sneakers that I got at Costco five or six years ago.  That's a long time for a walking sneaker, but those things refused to die.  They were some of the best money that I ever spent on footwear.  They've been pretty much indestructible, and they had the most comfortable insoles that I've ever had the pleasure of experiencing.  I've replaced the insoles a couple of times, but now the sneakers are looking long in the tooth.  Time for a new pair.  Unfortunately, it seems they don't make those particular sneakers anymore.  If they do, I can't find them.After looking over Amazon, I found these.  I'm not interested in any "fashion forward" screwball looking sneakers.  I just want I nice regular pair of sneakers at a reasonable price.  I've had pretty good luck buying sneakers online.  I order a size twelve and they fit without issue.  I was a little surprised when I first tried these sneakers on and they felt a little snug.  I like a snug sneaker, but these almost felt undersized.  I'm strictly talking about the width here.  Length wise they're fine.  I've been wearing them for over a week now, and they are definitely starting to break in.  They do feel like they run a little on the snug side, so if you like your sneakers roomy, you may want to consider going up half a size.Pros:- These were listed at $48.00 when I ordered them.  That's a good deal.  Assuming they hold up.- They feel well made and appear to be good quality.  (I'll revisit this after I've had them for awhile.)- They look good.  Of course, this is a matter of taste, but I think they look really nice.Cons:- They're a little on the snug side.  Okay by me, you might feel differently.- Short tongue.  Should be 1/2" to 1" longer.How they feel on your feet is a matter of taste.  These are getting more comfortable as I where them.  That's a good thing.  I like a snug fit, because I feel that it gives me more support.  You may feel otherwise.  I wish the soles were a little wider for more lateral stability.  This is a matter of individual preference.  The insoles are the soft and spongy type.  They provide comfort, but not much support.  I like them, but I don't think they'll last very long.  Overall, I'm happy with these so far.  If they hold up, I'll probably come back and up the rating to five stars.
My opinion these are the best walkers on the market. Great fit and support. This is my 2nd pair, wore the first ones out!

The shoes are very comfortable.  This is my go-to for work shoes because they work well with my messed up feet.  They accommodate the bunions on the outside of my foot, my messed-up pinky toe, and have good heel cushion.

I've been ordering the same shoes (with some slight model variations) for work from the same manufacturer for years. I'll usually wear them until the seams come apart or the tread wears out. The tread seemed to wear out pretty fast with the last couple pairs I bought, so I thought I'd try these instead.Got them yesterday and put them on today. Nice looking shoe. I'm worried about glue breaking down and the seam eventually  coming apart around the toe, but I guess that may or may not happen- will update. I usually order a wide shoe but that wasn't avail for this shoe, so they fit kind of snug. Not too snug though- definitely workable and I'm sure they'll loosen up as I break them in. Lots of cushioning. In fact, they're almost bouncy.Only issue out of the box is they are incredibly noisy. They squeak and creek with every movement. On both hard and soft surfaces, as well as wet and dry surfaces.  Mostly from the arch and heel area. And it's LOUD. I can't remember ever having shoes this noisy. I really hope they get less noisy as I wear them.UPDATE: So over 3 weeks later, the left shoe has quieted down a lot. It's still a little noisy though. The right shoe has shown no change. It sounds like a duck with each step I take, and it's quite loud. Inside, outside, wet, dry, hard surface or soft, this shoe is LOUD.  It's the rubber tread/sole on the bottom of the shoe that makes the noise. I'm almost 60 and I've never had shoes with this type of issue before. I'm very disappointed that a major brand like Reebok uses such crappy materials in their product. I WILL NOT be purchasing from Reebok again.UPDATE 2: So here it is 2 months later, and the right shoe is still loud as heck. It's the tread and the way it moves when I walk. It like rubs up against itself somewhere and makes that squeaking sound. I wear the shoes to work 6 days/week so you'd think it would have stopped by now. The other day it was raining and these shoes got soaked. They were too wet to wear the next day so I wore my back-ups, which are my previous pair by another brand. I was immediately reminded how nice it was to walk without loud noises coming from my shoes. That's it. I'm throwing these away and ordering a pair of my regular brand. will not buy these again.

Quality just OK. Not as good as previous models. Wears quickly inside the back heel and has an annoying squeak when walking. But I guess, for the price, it's OK. Functions well as a light and comfortable walking shoe.

title: Reebok Men's Rb4041 Sublite Cushion Safety Toe Athletic Work Shoe Black
Customer_say: Customers find these work shoes comfortable, well-made, and appreciate their lightweight design as the lightest alloy-toe shoes available. They consider them worth the price and report that their feet rarely hurt anymore. The fit and durability receive mixed feedback - while some say they fit well and hold up well, others find them too narrow and report durability issues with the outer soles. The feel is also mixed, with some praising the cushioned sole while others note the stiff sole.

Review.review: Good, lightweight, comfortable work shoes for individuals who spend a lot of time walking and standing, great for kneeling and needing a flexible shoe so as to be on the ball of the foot and not on the toecap.  No climbing hill, but it has a flexible sole for a good grip. In medium to high work industries, shoes will only last for approximately one year. Saying that I'm on my 3ed pair.

I bought these for my husband because he works long hours on his feet in a warehouse, and he was always complaining about foot pain. Since he started wearing these, he says the difference is huge. First thing he told me was, “they feel like sneakers!” They’re lightweight, super cushioned inside, and the safety toe doesn’t bother him at all.He also really liked the design — they don’t look like the usual heavy, bulky work shoes. He finishes the day with much less foot pain now, which makes him happy (and me too). Highly recommend these if you’re looking for something both comfortable and tough.

These steel toe shoes have been a solid choice for work. Right out of the box, they were surprisingly comfortable, with enough cushioning and support to get through long shifts without sore feet. The steel toe protection is solid, and the shoes feel sturdy without being too heavy or bulky.They’ve held up well over time—through rough surfaces, long hours, and all kinds of weather. The grip is reliable, and the materials are tough enough for daily wear in demanding environments.That said, after about a year of regular use, the original insoles started to wear down, and I noticed some foot fatigue. Swapping in a good pair of aftermarket insoles made a big difference and brought the comfort right back.

These are some fantastic work shoes. I bought them off the shoe truck in 2017 when I noticed a lot of co-workers wearing them, now retiring them for a new pair after 2 years in the warehouse.Lugging boots in and out of a sit down and stand up forklift all day can get tiring and even painful once the company starts requiring that mandatory 20 hours of OT at the end of the week. These things are so light weight, my top of foot pain has gone away. I'd actually gone jogging with them once...back in 2017.They have a decent amount of room in the toe area, never get any crowding. The cut-across design of the bottom of the shoe allows for extreme flexibility, meaning when you're squatting down to check that pallet label, the rear and sides of the shoe don't dig into your ankles as much. Pretty comfortable for an uncomfortable position.These things have kicked pallets, kicked boxes, kicked racks, forklifts and even a couple co-workers. I used the toe to drag pallets out on a daily basis, the mesh on top held up pretty well considering how wreckless I am with them.I tried a couple pairs of quality boots, a couple cheap pairs of steel toes from local department stores. These are much cooler and more comfortable than all of those. I'm a very warm mammal and get sweaty from time to time, switching from boots to these have eliminated that issue.The alloy toe means they're very light which is important if you're walking 15,000-20,000 steps a day while jumping in and out of equipment.I think two years is a bit longer than you'd want to stretch it, much of the padding in the heel had disappeared, but I wore these til the day my new ones were delivered with no issues.Adding an additional insole made these even more comfortable. I'm a big guy (240 lbs) so standing 10-12 hours, I need the extra cushion, but the included cushioning would probably suffice for those sit down forklift weeks.Gotta say, if you're on your feet all day and you haven't tried work shoes and have always been a boots person, you need to try these.

While if this was a normal shoe from me it would at least get a 4 star review based on its Comfort, Perceived Durability and Materials Makeup.This shoe will only recieve a 3 star review because of one category Slip Resistance.Slip Resistance - This shoe claims slip resistance. I'm not sure what this is actually for whether its for dirt or whether it's for oil. Typically I see it for oil.(Just a heads up I write this first for the people who depend on this category for work. I do not hate this shoe and rather like it)I will say that this shoe on normal ground (just like your average shoe) grips great but the moment oil is introduced you will start sliding. I work in a manufacturing environment for food where cooking oil is always around.I cannot help but slip all over the floors of my place of work even with the claim these shoes make. I give this category a 1 out of 5Comfort - This shoe is pretty comfortable I would give it a solid 4 out of 5 in that. I had to buy wide as the toe area squished my toes on the first pair I bought.It hugs your shoe but it does have some space between the top of your foot and the top of the shoe. Even after tieing it tightly. Also the Steel Toe in this show is not uncomfortable which is a plus.Percieved Durability - I will say that from what I can see after wearing them for a week is that this shoe will be very durable. It wont be prone to the side walls stretching out due to the reinforcement on the sides. Definitely a 4 out of 5 on thisMaterials Choice - I will say that everything on this shoe feels mostly premium. The mesh is good and not cheaply made and the steel toe is good.The only thing I will say badly about this is that the bottom of the shoe sole does not feel premium and it feels more like foam than it feels like rubber. I will give this a 3 out of 5.Good luck on your purchase. I do actually recommend this product if you wont be working in an oily environment as these will definitely keep your feet safe and comfortable.

title: Reebok Nano X4 Mens Shoes, Cross Training Gym Sneakers for Men
Customer_say: Customers find these shoes to be of good quality, with one noting they're perfect for training and daily wear. The shoes receive positive feedback for their appearance and stability during workouts, with one customer mentioning they help with balance during weight training. However, customers disagree on the fit, with some finding them comfortable while others feel uncomfortable. Moreover, durability is a concern as the plastic near the heel cracks on both sides, and customers disagree on the stiffness of the soles.

Review.review: These shoes are excellent for both the gym and casual wear. They’re lightweight yet supportive, with a solid grip that feels stable during workouts. The cushioning is comfortable without being too soft, which makes them perfect for lifting, running short distances, and everyday use. Stylish and versatile.

The Reebok Nano X4s are not just shoes—they're a lifestyle. Honestly, I feel like I could climb a mountain, wrestle a bear, and then hit a CrossFit WOD all in the same day with these bad boys on my feet. 🐻🏋️‍♂️First off, the comfort is unreal. It’s like Reebok secretly hired a team of NASA scientists to design a shoe that hugs your feet like a clingy toddler. Whether I’m lifting, running, or just strutting around pretending I’m in a sneaker commercial, these kicks have me feeling unstoppable. 💪🚀The grip? Let’s just say I could probably run up a wall like Spider-Man if I really wanted to (I haven’t tried... yet). They’re stable enough to keep me grounded during squats but flexible enough to make burpees almost bearable. Almost.And let’s not ignore the style. These shoes are so sleek that even my non-gym-going friends have been asking, "Where’d you get those?" I’ve caught myself looking down at my feet mid-workout and thinking, "Damn, I look good." 💃👟Bottom line: The Nano X4s are the Swiss Army knife of sneakers. If you want a shoe that screams, “I’m here to dominate this workout, but I also look cool doing it,” these are for you. Reebok, you’ve outdone yourself. My only complaint? Now I need them in every color. 🔥
Muy cómodos tanto para pesas como caminar o saltar, si buscas unos zapatos versátiles estos son mejores que los metcon que solo sirven para levantamientos
I want to bad to find something like the old Reebok Nano TRs. These aren’t it. The heel drop is higher and the toe box is much more tight. Had to return.
Excelente producto
Wrong size delivered (far too small). Did not like the design at all. Returned quickly.

I fell in love with the Nano line back in the day and something drastically changed with the design after the 5 and I wasn’t impressed. I tried the Nano 9 in 2019 but still didn’t like the changes.Fast forward to these and I’m definitely a fan! They’re a solid base, comfortable, handle rope climbs with excellent grip, and work well on short runs! I’m glad Reebok improved the design with the X4. They look great and I think they should last a while.
The toe of the shoe started coming off after day 3 of wearing them. They’re not made like they use to make them.

title: Reebok Women's Walk Ultra 7 DMX Max Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these walking shoes comfortable, well-made, and appreciate their strong arch support for all-day standing. The shoes receive positive feedback for their appearance and value for money. However, customers disagree on the fit, with some finding them perfect while others say they're too small, and there are mixed experiences with foot pain. Additionally, several customers report that the shoes squeak significantly when walking.

Review.review: I received these today and have been wearing them all afternoon. They are so comfortable! A lot of shoes just make my feet hurt, even expensive tennis shoes, so that's saying something. These shoes are  lightweight and offer good support. I love that they are waterproof and have good traction. I ordered size 8.5 wide and they fit true to size, and my toes have plenty of room. Since I am on my feet a lot, I really needed a good pair of tennis shoes, and these are a great value.

I got these shoes for my nursing program. I have to be on my feet 2-3 times a week for long hours and these have never left my feet sore. They are about a year old and still have a solid grip on the soles and are very durable. They have good ankle support and keep my feet warm during the colder months. Walking is comfortable and feels supportive.

These were more like I needed for work as all black is best. Non slip sole, strong support for all day standing. Very comfortable. It is slight adjustment to not walk on toes, as the front is higher.  I normally wear a Size 6, but ordered 6 1/2 to have more room, as 6 would have been too small. Satisfied with value as cheaper than Nikes. Good quality but not last as long as Nikes that I have.
great fit, great comfort
Love my reebok shoes, fit ture to size package was great. Cost was great, will buy again

As a Sketcher girl I rarely buy anything else. However, I needed black shoes for a second job and Skechers didn’t have any that would have worked. Needed lots of padding as I’d be on my feet a lot. Wore these shoes for six hours last night and didn’t even know I had shoes on my feet. Super comfortable, great padding, and easy to stand on concrete for that amount of time without pain in my feet or legs. Highly recommend!

These shoes carried me through nursing school. They are not the most comfortable. I was a little disappointed but refused to by another pair of white leather shoes for school only. They are easy to clean and had great quality. Just need more cushion.

I wore these for probably two semesters of nursing school. I sized up just in case they were too small. They were a tad bigger than expected for sizing up, but they worked. Although, the soles began to peel away so the sides were talking. I’d say this may have been due to being too big causing a bit of a clown toe angle. Soles were basic comfort, not necessarily walking on cloud nine. My feet eventually did ache the more I wore them.

title: Under Armour Men's Charged Surge 4 Sneaker
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, fashionable while walking, and appreciate their lightweight design and good value for money. The fit and appearance receive positive feedback, with one customer noting they're suitable for wide feet. While some customers say the shoes hold up well, others report durability issues, and opinions about sizing are mixed, with some finding them accurate while others say they run small.

Review.review: Love these shoes, they are extremely comfortable and crafted nicely. They are also made with breathable material so your feet are not being cooked. They are appealing to the eye as well. The material appears to be easy to clean. I believe these shoes will be durable and last for a long time. There is some arch support within the side of the sole but not a much. I ordered them black in color, the color is dark and has a little bit of a shine to it. They go well with anything I wear and they fit perfectly.  They function well and cushion every step.

These are proving to be great shoes for my son! He purchased two other pair & had to return them. Then he decided to try these out. The comfort & fit were both perfect for him! The support was great. This includes the arch support, of course. In terms of durability; So far so good! He walks up to 5 miles a day on average & there's not too many signs of wear just yet!

These seem to have good support for my son and fit has slightly wide feet well. The white sole is easily cleaned and the black uppers hide dirt and stains well which is always a plus for making kids shoes last longer. The style is simple but cool enough for a 10 year old and they are nice and flexible with a thick sole.
Value for the money is great. Good comfort, cushion and fit.  Size is on point.  very light weight. Seems like they should last for walking and some light jogging.

The Under Armour Men's Charged Surge 4 is a popular running sneaker known for being comfortable, lightweight, and versatile. It is considered a neutral shoe, providing a balance of flexibility and cushioning.Key features include a breathable mesh upper with synthetic overlays for structure, a Deluxe Comfort System sockliner that molds to your foot, and a Charged Cushioning midsole for responsiveness and durability. The sneaker also has a durable rubber outsole for traction.It's a great option for light exercise, walking, and all-day wear, and many reviewers find it to be a good value

Was wary of buying shoes without trying them on first.  But these are true to size and are pretty nice for jogging and daily wear.Pros: fits well, and give a lot of comfort.  These are some of the most cushioning shoes I've had.  Granted, I'm not on my feel all day, but I probably walk more than most office workers.Cons: Nothing significant.Other thoughts:These aren't "sneakers" in the way that they make you silent.  The bottom of the shoes are harder than my Nikes, and make a little bit of sound when you walk on a hard floor.  Not an issue unless you're an aspiring ninja.The bottom part of the shoe (the white piece) is larger than your feet.  This gives more stability, but makes your feet look a bit bigger than they are compared with my Nikes.The top of the shoes are breathable.  They are mesh rather than a simple fabric like my Nikes.  As a result, they don't stretch as much.  Just a personal preference which one you like more.Finally - this came in its original shoe box and the box was a bit squashed.  Didn't bother the shoe at all.
Super comfortable shoe that looks great as well! Easily one of my favorite pairs to throw on. It fits true to size and ill definitely be buying another pair once these have run their course.

The black sneakers are pretty good for the price. They’re comfortable to walk in and look good with almost any outfit. The material quality is decent, though they don’t seem as durable as some more expensive models. After a few weeks of use, they’re still holding up well. They’re not the lightest shoes, but overall they do the job. A good purchase if you’re looking for something simple and practical.

title: Reebok Womens Lite Plus 3.0 Ortholite Running & Training Shoes
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes decent in quality, cute in style, and appreciate their lightweight design. The comfort and fit receive mixed feedback - while some find them extremely comfortable, others report feet hurting, and while some say the fit is great, others mention they run slightly narrow. The sizing is also mixed, with some saying the size is true while others find them running wildly small.

Review.review: This shoe is comfortable from the start.  I bought a 1/2 size larger and fits good.  Good quality and looks good.

I have degenerative disc disorder and arthritis in both knees so I have special shoe needs. They accommodate my wide foot. But I think I would order a half size up from my norm. The sole is slightly wider than the shoe which helps keep my body centered and relieves the stress on both my knees and back.  They wash nicely as well.

I originally bought these sneakers in my regular size on another e-commerce site. I liked the style and quality, but they were too tight, so I returned them. I read the reviews on Amazon and other people had the same problem, so I assume it's an issue with this particular sneaker. I ordered them a half-size larger, and now they fit okay.
the shoes look nice, but they are soooo uncomfortable. The soles are hard and my feet hurt after just a couple of hours of wearing them.

This would’ve been 5 stars had the size been accurate. I’ve worn 9.5 M Reeboks for years and this one fits more like a 9, my big toe is already at the very tip of the shoe. Though I’ll expect it to stretch out a bit with wearing it in. What I didn’t expect is that it had arch support, what a bonus! So this is quite comfy to walk in with just its stock insole though I would like it with a bit more cushioning. It also looks better in actuality than in the pics. I’ve always been looking for white, comfy sneaks as my daily driver and have worn my previous Reebok ones for years, good to have an alternative now.
Need a bigger size need size 7 s
Toe box was too narrow.

title: Reebok Men's Lite Plus 3 Sneakers
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, lightweight, and stylish, with good quality and a reasonable price point. The fit receives mixed feedback, with several customers noting they run a little small. The durability also gets mixed reviews, with one customer reporting they only last about a year with daily wear.

Review.review: As expected
My son had a blue pair and wanted a black one as well. He says they are very comfortable and wears them for work.
Purchased these a few times as my bf really likes them but unfortunately they only last about a year with daily wear.  Decent quality for the price.
Exactly as described but 10.5 compared to other reebok 10.5 is substantially smaller. Go up a size if going by past reebok sizes.
muy estrechos

El zapato es bonito, se ve duradero, pero las tallas no concuerdan, soy 8 y pedí 8.5 para que no me quedaran apretados. No fué lo que esperaba el zapato me quedaba muy apretado en el medio, y se me recogían los dedos al caminar, incómodo. Si eres de pies anchos como yo, no te recomiendo estos zapatos.

I have bought size 11 shoes almost all my adult life, with few brand exceptions. These shoes are very tight, almost to the point of being unwearable on my feet. I will give them a few more days to stretch out, but otherwise will likely gift them, slightly-worn, to a friend and get another pair of shoes.

Not much to say, these are excellent shoes"These shoes are excellent. The quality is fantastic and the price is unbeatable. However, the sizing is not very accurate. I ordered a size 13 and they are a bit tight on me. Other than that, these are truly great shoes and I highly recommend them. Just be sure to order a size up if you are between sizes."

title: Reebok Men's Classic Nylon Sneakers
Customer_say: Customers find these sneakers to be high-quality, comfortable, and well-fitting, with one noting they're great nursing shoes. They appreciate the timeless style, classic design, and multiple color options. The shoes are durable, with one customer mentioning they hold up well even when wet, and customers consider them good value for money.

Review.review: These shoes are  very  comfortable.  Very nice. Plus I got then a day earlier.  Which is so cool
They are true to size , good material, lightweight, and comfortable .
I bought these and the gray pair, I get compliments all the time. These are dope throwbacks, they’er comfortable, they don’t break the bank. I’m definitely going to buy some more colors.
The size was true and they were Limited Edition 50 Year Anniversary to boot.

I've owned at least one pair of the Reebok Classics for roughly 2 decades.  Each one has lasted me 5+ years, after which I use the pair as my work shoes when mowing the lawn or other yardwork.  It's a comfortable and durable shoe, that's not too expensive.I've had a difficult time finding this style/color shoe in the past 5 years, and the price has more than doubled during that time.  So I was very happy to find it on Amazon at a price lower than elsewhere.The shoes I received were clean, and genuine with no faults.  They fit perfectly and comfortably right away, as I expected with the Reebok Classic Sneaker.
If you like simple Sneaks. The price from this vendor excellent $31. Fit great look/feel good.

The product came on time , the shoes where new , but the the shoe box was ripped up to smithorings like if a bear came and destroyed the box . I use the box to store and maintain my shoe in my closet . That was disappointing

title: Reebok womens Running Shoes
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, with one mentioning their feet don't hurt or get tired while wearing them. Moreover, the shoes receive positive feedback for their quality, with one customer noting they're great for all-day walking. Additionally, customers like the color, describing it as amazing. However, customers disagree on the sizing, with some finding them too small.

Review.review: I took the advice from others to size up. I usually wear a size 9 or 9 1/2 in tennis shoes. I bought a size 10 and they fit perfectly. Very comfortable on out of the box. I would say a nice burnt orange color. I haven’t taken them jogging yet but they seem to be nice quality just by the look and feel of them on around the house.

Just took these on a trip where I was walking all day for multiple days in a row. My feet did not hurt or get tired. I thought that they fit a bit too snug, but even with a thick sock, they were great. If they had been waterproof, then they would have been perfect!
Muy comodos y suaves
Excelente calidad y buen precio

I wish I would have taken the reviews seriously about these shoes running too small. I am a 7 1/2 but sometimes buy size 8 depending on the type of shoe. I got the size 8 and it was not just too short but very narrow and I have narrow feet. I just returned them and didn't want to take the chance of trying a different size and being disappointed. Not sure if it's this style show or the stock amazon has in this shoe. Definitely buy a size up or two if purchasing!!

Ordered an eight and should have ordered 8 1/2. The shoe was made short and the upper material It has a lot of air holes. all in all it does not feel bad decent walking shoe. I probably wouldn’t run in them as they feel narrow.
Beautiful colorTrue to size
Very comfortable true to size. Paid 29$ on sale so a deal for sure.From the pictures u can get a very good idea of how they look. All around great shoe very light with breathable fabric.

title: Reebok Men's Floatride Energy 3.0 Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, lightweight, and good value for money. They appreciate the cushioning and quality, with one customer noting they feel amazing even after half a year of use. The shoes run a little big, and customers report that they hurt their ankles. The durability receives mixed feedback, with several customers expressing concerns about longevity.

Review.review: Have started using this shoe as my daily running shoe.  Only have a handful of days using them, but so far they are very good.  They have the right cushioning feel, which I think is important for staying injury-free.  Nice toe-box room, which is #2 on my priority list since I have sort of big feet with a size 13, and don't like a cramped toe feeling which sometimes happens.  Heel collar doesn't feel tight around my ankle, which can be a big negative for me as well. The price was very reasonable as well.  All in all, very satisfied.

These were the first pair of running shoes I purchased after hours of online research and I am so glad I picked these!I have been running in these shoes for the past 6-7 months and they have been so comfortable that I am debating on buying myself another pair! I can attest that these shoes have been pretty durable and still feel amazing half a year later. The area I live in has significant rain however I haven’t had any issues with slipping. Reviews online have mentioned that these shoes are best for short runs (3-5 miles) but I regularly go on 8-10 mile runs in these shoes without any problem. And finally, aesthetic wise, I love the classic reebok style.
For the price, this show is a steal!! It is comfortable and provides good bounce/energy return. I would give it a 5, but my Puma Velocity Nitro takes that cake!

I was looking for walking shoes but read that running shoes could be just as good for everyday wear. I wear them with sport, casual and dress casual clothing and they look good. Very very comfortable. Light color and mesh stain easily but can be cleaned with proper sneaker cleaning products. Good quality and comfort overall.

I had been watching cusing Brooks Ghostsb tr for years, but after the uppers on my last pair split after only 5 months, I decided to try these.  They’re very light and cushiony, which is just what I need since I’ve had a plantar fasciitis issue lately.  Have only walked in them so far but hope to resume running soon.  If they last at least 6 months I’ll be happy. Note - these run a little big. A half size in my case.
Soy médico y lo mejor para las guardias

I have been using Reeboks Foatride 2s for several years because they were well cushioned, light, and well-priced.Although they were not particularly durable, they also have good traction on all but muddy surfaces.  I use them for running, walking, and a bit of hiking.Since they seem to have phased out the floatride 2s, I've shifted to floatride 3s.  Unfortunately, their "lasts," however, vary a bit and range from normal American (Ds) to somewhat narrow fits.  I've tried three of these. The first and thrid were OK. However, the middle one was much narrower than usual, and the upper part of the heel is not well designed and irritates the heel, at least my heel. So, I had to send it back to Amazon.  The first and third models (including this black one), even of this particular line, fit perfectly.Although, I would say that the first one that I tried (a blue model) was the best of the three for fit etc.
Like everything about these shoes, style, color, comfort

title: Reebok Unisex-Adult Nano Zero Sneaker

Review.review: These shoes are great if you are looking for a zero drop shoe with a wider toe area. They aren’t extremely wide, but for me just perfect. Really a great shoe for squats. I also do a lot of work that requires me to walk on roofs and this shoe is very comfortable and provides great traction on an asphalt or cedar shake roof.I hope Reebok continues to provide a shoe option with a zero drop sole, these are really great. I have tried many of the barefoot shoes and these are way more comfortable and practical for wearing outside of workouts where the barefoot shoes are great for a workout, but you look kind of weird walking around or working in a barefoot shoe.

This is by far one of the most perfect lifting shoes, they have an amazing ground feeling. I personally use them for heavy squats and deadlift as they offer superior stability and support, also they feel so comfortable they can be worn for most exercises. Reebok has bridged the gap between barefoot shoes and workout shoes, weather you’re looking for a casual shoes to wear to the gym that will give you great feel with the wider toe box to intense sessions of powerlifting and CrossFit these are to go shoes. They are flexible yet very well built and constructed from materials that will last and the pair are very light in weight that you will feel comfortable wearing for extended periods of time. When it comes to sizing these for me are true to size, I wear size 11 on the Reebok nano and I find the same size works for these. Reebok well done on these, most exciting shoe release of the year.One more point. Compared to other barefoot workout shoes or low stack height shoes these are perfectly priced compared to other who exaggerate their prices especially that these are made from higher quality material

Not a barefoot shoe. Stack height is only around 10mm plus a 2mm insole, but sole is very stiff (in flexibility and hardness). No cushioning, but no ground feel either. Shoe looks good other than branding. I would have preferred a gum colored huge "Reebok" if it's got to be there.I have a EE width foot with a large midfoot. The toebox was great, but the distal end of the laces is too far down IMO. The shoe rubs on top of my taller than normal foot at the crease. Removing the insole made the shoe fit perfect, but the shoe isn't made to use without the insole.Shoe seemed solid though. The upper material is nice and breathable. I was really close to keeping the shoe. If my midfoot wasn't abnormally large, i would have kept it.
Excelente
Muy buenos
Recomendados al 100 … producto en excelentes condiciones … estos tenis para entrenamiento brindan mucha seguridad y confianza 😎🫡
Son ligeras y resistentes.

title: Reebok Women's Zig Dynamica 5 Sneaker
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, nice-looking, and of high quality. They appreciate the traction, with one customer noting they're perfect for the gym. The fit receives mixed feedback - while some say they run true to size, others find them a little snug in the width.

Review.review: these are the cutest tennis shoes! also very comfortable - I've never owned reebok before so I am impressed!I got my usual size & they fit great - a little snug in the width but that's typical with all new shoes & it's not at all uncomfortable.They also feel very supportive & sturdy!
Very nice shoes. Very comfortable
super cute, very comfy, & perfect for the gym! would definitely recommend!
Comfortable and cute.  The fit is perfect and it is a good quality shoe for walking a distance.  Feels light on the foot.  And was a good shoe for the price.
Why did you pick this product vs others?:True to size, always getting compliments
These are my most comfortable tennis shoes ever. I suffer from planta fasciitis from time to time. These help me to stand on my feet with the least amount of pain during my 4-6 hour shifts at work.

ME ENCANTAAAAAAAN ❤️❤️❤️ siempre me dijo en la suela porque tienden a dolerme los pies por mi trabajo, pero son perfectos, acolchados, se ven divinos, son mis primeros Reebok y quedé enamorada, generalmente soy 9 pero compré 9,5 porque leí en los comentarios acerca de la talla y me quedaron super bien

I returned theses shoes. I really liked the color, but they were hard and not very comfortable with the try-on. I feel like my feet would have been sore for a while before they were "broken in." Size seemed accurate though. I bought size 7 and it fit as expected.

title: Reebok Womens Zig Dynamica Str
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, with one mentioning their feet no longer hurt, and appreciate their style, particularly noting the all-white with tan sole design. The shoes fit true to size, are lightweight, and receive positive feedback for their quality, with one customer noting they're better than Hokas for running. They like the balance features, with one mentioning the flared sole provides stability when walking, and consider them worth the price.

Review.review: I really like these shoes, and they are very comfortable.  I have worn these 100's of times now and they are so comfortable and are keeping up with my walking schedule and not wearing out.  The quality is excellent for the price. They are wide enough in the shoe box and do not slip on the heels.  Overall great pair of athletic shoes.

Better than Hokas for running. My Hokas are comfy but the incline pushes my weight to the front of the shoe, making my toes and balls of my feet hurt. This shoe evenly distributes body weight. Sizing is accurate. Looks stylish as well.
Comfortable and light!

Forgot just how much I like Reebok until I got these shoes. Great fit, very study around ankle and the flared sole allows for balance when walking.  I am a standard 7.5 size and my toes are to the end I wear lite weight socks. Very comfortable I wear all day. Love the look! Would buy again

I never thought Reebok would be one of my go to, but I absolutely love these shoes. I have a three pair and I love them. The white with the lavender are really pretty. I do have a hard time finding something to wear with them or his case scenario, I just wear them with my leggings. They’re perfect for the gym or just for walking.

It took a good 3 weeks to break these shoes in, but once they did they've been great shoes! I'm short so I love the extra inch they give me in height lol. They bend with my feet, I work retail so I'm on my feet all day long. My feet no longer hurt when I get home from work which is a plus for me.

I bought these shoes for work as I’m a surgical assistant and on my feet 11-12 hrs a day. They did not disappoint at all. I put in more arch support but I do that with all shoes. They weren’t missing anything specific and I wear them most days.

I was a little bit leery about the foam soles, but so far so good.  They have already lasted me longer than a $70 pair of pumas i bought recently.  I’ve been running in these 2-3 times per week, washed them a couple of times, and they still look brand new.  Perfect fit.

title: Reebok Mens Flexagon Energy 4 Lace-Up Padded Insole Running & Training Shoes
Customer_say: Customers find these training shoes comfortable, lightweight, and sleek in style. They appreciate the traction, with one customer noting they can walk all day. Regarding size, while some find them true to size, others report they run too narrow.

Review.review: Love it. My husband loves them. Very comfortable n true to size. Bottom sole is rubber.

I hate the entire shoe buying process and ordered these because I was desperate for a new pair. They arrived very lightweight super comfy. Haven’t had any ankle pain. I’m a bigger guy pushing 260 and they are amazing.

Very comfortable. The soles flex easily. I have a bad foot and stiffer shoes give me problems. The only issue I have with it is it’s only for summer and warmer weather. When it rains, it gets wet on the inside.

I usually wear Nike, so I was disappointed that these ran smaller than Nike. I had to send it back because it was a tight fit. Other than that, it was comfortable and had a nice design; it actually looks better in person. I’d suggest it to those who wear Reebok.

I like these shoes I buy a pair every summer. They’re soft and comfortable if you don’t hurt when you walk in them and you can walk all day and have no pain. I wear them at work and I’m on my feet 13 hours a day.

Spouse needed shoes for work and unfortunately these gave him a blister in the back of his ankle 😒.  Sucks when you work for a delivery company and constantly on your feet. Other then that he said they feel ok.
Great sneakers at a great price. Very fashionable and look great on I would highly recommend this item. It is set at a great price.
muy buena claidad, la talla exacta

title: Reebok Women's Glide Sneaker
Customer_say: Customers find these sneakers comfortable, well-made, and good value for money, appreciating their bright white color and great style. The size receives mixed feedback, with some saying they run true to size while others find them too narrow. The support and durability aspects also get mixed reviews, with some finding decent support while one customer reports the shoes falling apart within a week.

Review.review: I’ve noticed a lot of negative reviews on this item and I am here to say ignore them. The ones showing torn up boxes and complaining about it are full of themselves, along with saying their shoes came discolored or used in some way. It’s a lie, plain and simple. My box came in perfect condition. Also my shoes came in perfect condition. The comfort of these shoes are amazing, the style is just like I remember growing up and walking ability is awesome. The quality of these shoes are great and the fit is a little snug but that’s just because they are new and need to be “broke in”, just like any other shoe you would buy. Ease of cleaning is good. Over all, I’d give these shoes ten stars and I would buy them again and again. Don’t listen to the haters. Just because they have a box in their picture showing a torn up box doesn’t mean it came that way and if it did, then it’s the fault of the mail carrier not the seller. The ones showing pictures of their “used discolored shoes” well, they wore them and then complained about it being the sellers fault. Entitlement is real out in this world. It takes a little common sense to figure out these shoes are wonderful and to not listen to the negative Nancy’s. I’m going to buy another pair. These look great and feel great! But them you won’t be disappointed.
Simple, comfortable, and just a quality shoe overall. They fit true to size.

I don’t wear sneakers very often because It’s easier (for me) to wear heels. So these sneakers are comfortable and it has a small lift at the back of the heel so the foot is not completely flat. So walking for miles in Europe it was great!! Especially on cobblestones. They are also fashionable. I use a size 5 or kids 3

These were a quick, last minute extra Christmas purchase when I find out Mom's main go to sneaks had amassed more mileage than expected. These arrived overnight & at a great price. They ended up fitting her perfectly & she says they are super comfy to wear when she's out & about for multiple hours. Pretty sure when these start to wear I'll just get her the exact same pair again. Maybe a new Christmas tradition??

I like the classic look of these shoes; however, the toe box is tapered so my big toe was almost touching the tip. These were on my wish list for a while since I tried them on in a store; I purchased them when the price went down. I wanted white sneakers to wear with dresses. I consider white a neutral color. But compare to Sketchers and Hoka, these have stiff and flat insoles. They’re not uncomfortable, but I already own comfortable sneakers. I returned them.
Great shoes- comfy and durable.
Fits well and it's comfortable and the price is good.

title: Reebok Unisex-Adult Floatride Energy Century Grow Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, well-fitting, and nice-looking, with one customer noting they're good for everyday gym use. The material quality receives mixed feedback, with one customer mentioning they're made from 50% plant-based material. The durability is concerning, with one customer reporting fraying after just two weeks of use.

Review.review: Had this in my cart for a few weeks before finalizing my purchase. When I finally did I was still hesitant. When I got them the were a bit tight in the mid section but after wearing it 2 times they got really comfortable. The only draw back I have for this is the material, someone stepped on my foot the first night out and I have to use a mild brush with soap and water to get it out. But that's just about it.

I got these about two years ago and they are still kicking. Great value, I got a lot of miles out of them. They survived me two international trips and many trail hikes. The fit is a little on the snug side at first so if you have a wider foot keep that in mind. The color and style . I did not much care for at first. First the good.  The shoe is lightweight.  Laces stay tied during long runs and the sole of the shoe is comfortable for the most part during runs.  If you are worried about the environment shoe is made from 50% plant based material.  What that exactly is, is not specified anywhere on the shoe.  My geuss would be cotton.  It feels like a canvas type shoe but not as soft.  Shoe fits well enough.  I tend to buy wider shoes but didn't have to with this shoe.  If you have a narrow foot, this shoe might be too big width wise.The bad.  The insole of this shoe does not remove.  It's also just a flat piece glued into the shoe and one could easily add their favorite insole on top and hopefully not lose much space inside the show.  The shoe is made with a rougher material.  Similar to canvas.  Unfortunately there is no additional padding around the Achilles' heel portion of the shoe and the heel tab part of the shoe rides up a little higher than most and doesn't have a notch.  Which leads to my biggest issue.  For me running with this shoe with no-show socks or no socks at all creates a rubbing action against my Achilles' heel and gets very raw and painful.  Even on a short run (3 miles) this becomes an issue.  I have to wear socks that completely cover this area in order to not have the issue.The rubber sole is very thin and seems to be wearing out quite rapidly.  I doubt I will get my normal use (around 500 miles light running) out of these running shoes.  These shoes may be better suited for walking.  I don't recommend them for running shoes because of the issues I observed.UPDATE:  Only used this for running about a month, switched it to a walking shoe and it pretty much fell a part very quickly.  Avoid this shoe, not worth the money.

I bought these shoes to replace my Reebok CrossFit ones, which lasted me for almost seven years. I wore them for CrossFit, spinning lessons, cross-training, and weight lifting, and they were simply great. After a few workouts with these Nano ones, I'd like to share my experience.I'll be honest: I was impressed the first time I wore them for leg day. They have enough room in the toe box for weight lifting, are very sturdy, gave me no blisters, but I did notice my feet didn't feel completely comfortable, no arch support (like the CrossFit ones have), and the fit felt off.After a couple of weeks wearing them, my opinion has shifted. These are supposed to be good for cross-training, but if you are doing mild walking and/or prolonged standing with them, your feet will hurt on the toes and the heels. They are ok for weight lifting, considering the fit is not as great as the CrossFit ones, but definitely not for anything that includes walking. These shoes are NOT an improvement. The fit, the comfort, and the sturdiness are just not there. I remember being able to run and jump with the CrossFit ones, so I guess I'm just disappointed. I wish I had gone with the TYR ones.

Lemme first say, I’m giving 4 stars because for the price, they are a well-made and clean looking, stylish shoe, they’re just not the shoe for me and potentially not for you:First - as someone else said, they run a half size big, so size 1/2 DOWN. Otherwise the heel slippage will be bad on these (not enough of a heel “cup” to keep them on)Even with my own high arch insoles put in, these shoes are STILL not giving enough support against overpronation. And I don’t even have a severe case! I’m starting to get pains reminiscent of shin splints, JUST from walking around with these at work! There are 2 main issues that are causing me to invest in a better shoe:1. Lack of stability - this shoe wasn’t advertised as a stability shoe, so I’m not holding it against them. Just letting you know that if you’re on the fence about these versus a proper stability shoe for your overpronation or arch issues, go for the stability shoe. Even just for casual walking, the support makes a difference.2. Poor “flow” from heel to toe - I think there’s a proper term for this but I forget. Point is, even when walking (and I’d imagine it’d be worse when running), the shoe actually seems to hamper my heel-to-toe movement rather than help it. This is why I bumped down to 4 stars - no matter your foot type, the steps should feel smooth and they don’t here.

title: Reebok Work All-Terrain Work Men's Oxford
Customer_say: Customers find these work shoes comfortable, with feet not hurting, and appreciate their high-quality steel toe design and lightweight, breathable construction. Review.review: I've been wearing these for 3 years this is the 1st pair I have purchased on Amazon.. Best steel toe shoe I have ever found that doesn't feel like a steel toe....The only complaint I have is I go through a pair every 3 months and I sit behind a desk I just do alot of walking in the warehouse. Good price for not feeling that steel rubbing on my feet I will continue to buy these shoes

These shoes are awesome. I've worn them for about two weeks now and I am very pleased. I work retail and do a lot of warehousing and I'm on my feet for about 8 hours a day, constantly walking, kicking doors, pushing heavy product across slippery warehouse floors, lifting, crunching boxes, etc.I think I would rate the grip-strength of the tread maybe about a 7 or 8 out of 10. You would probably have to go to an actual boot to do any better.After a full-day each day, my feet are not fatigued or sore with these shoes. They feel like a slightly heavier pair of tennis shoes and I hardly even notice that it has steel toes, but it does!I have not tried jogging in them yet, but so far they feel like another pair of high-quality tennis shoes. One unique thing that I discovered about these shoes the other day, was I had them laced up and needed to take one shoe off. It turns out that the fabric around the ankles has an elastic quality so it stretches so you can take your shoes off without having to untie them.Although, if I had to nit-pick, I would like the laces slightly shorter because the tongue of the shoe is completely fused with the shoes and there's no way to tuck your laces in. This is easy enough to change though.I give these shoes 5 stars!

Non Removable insoles made from memory foam, which fall flat after a few minutes. And I wish it was available in composite toe or soft toe because the shoe is pretty good, very interesting tongue design. More like a slip on shoe but with laces. Will see how long they last.Update 4-17-19: 3 days into wearing the shoes and the outer layer of rubber that's on the fabric is already cracked and peeling off.

Best work boot/shoe I've ever owned, and I've been working/wearing steel toed shoes for 35 plus years.I just hate they discontinued this particular shoe. My work place gives an allowance for buying work shoes but only from 2 or 3 specified retailers and these shoes are discontinued so I bought some on here with my on dollars because I loved them so much.
It is slip on shoes which is hard to put on due to stiffness. Moreover, it is NOT wide enough and it is too narrow even though I ordered wide.I don't recommend it.

The memory foam insert is very comfortable however it can be removed easily which means at times while wearing it it bunches up under my toes or heal and I have to take it off to adjust it quick. The shoes do look like clown shoes. Large around the toes. They are also very stiff. I couldn't imagine wearing these for outdoor activities such as hiking. Which they seem to be marketed for. These are much better work work use. Very breathable.

Going on six months of 40 hour a week use on concrete floors in a manufacturing facility. I still dig these shoes. They are comfy, though memory foam insole took a bit of getting used to.They are a bit heavy with the steel toe. An aluminum or comp. toe would be a wonderful option. That said, they are still pounds lighter than the Keen safety toed boots I had prior.Great traction in the central NY winter parking lot trek, but mind they are not waterproof and the slush can creep in before getting through the door from the truck.The shoes are holding up very well at this point. I went out of pocket on these and am glad I did. I will buy another pair when these wear out. I'll update the review at that point, but I expect a good two years out them by how they are holding up.I do suggest getting a wide size for toe room, but that holds true with any steel toed shoe/boot, especially if one is prone to ingrown toenails or bunions.Also, I kinda like the fact that I don't wear the same shoes as everyone else in the plant and I get to offer the EHS folks a kick in the shin when they ask me if I have safety toes.. heh

Almost two years into owning these for Factory work and they're holding up well. Only a small tear on each shoe from the bending of the steel toe. Extremely comfortable and allow you to move quick on your feet, and the fitment is great for a steel toe shoe. Will definitely be buying these again once they finally give out on me.

Im a woman btw, but this fits completely my size and contours to my foot in the sole. I dont want to wear any other shoe ever!!! besides going barefoot, this is the shoe to get!!!

These are great shoes. They're super light and offer perfect stability and support for my cardio kickboxing and weightlifting classes. I've been using them a 4-5 times a week for about three months now, and they've held up perfectly. Theyre comfortable enough that I'm considering a second pair to wear out and about as well!

I really like the looks of this shoe, they seem well made and are very affordable. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is that they are a little bit larger (longer) than other major brands size 9. It may be that an 8.5 would be a better fit, but rather than return and exchange for 8.5 (and risk some other unexpected fit, like too narrow), I'll just live with the little bit of extra space in front of the toes. If you are trying to decide between 2 half sizes, you might want to choose the smaller size. That said, I don't know if the extra length is true throughout all the sizes. Maybe size 12 is spot on? However, if you are trying to decide 8.5 or 9, consider the 8.5. The size 9 are a little long.

These are nice for $35 shoes, comfortable, true to size, light, the insole is soft.  They definitely feel different from a more expensive comparable shoe from Nike for instance, but for my use it's fine.  Perhaps don't run a marathon in these, otherwise theyre great shoes

They look cute and it seems they have cushionbut unfortunately, they don't. They have a nice memory foam insole but it is like stepping on a hardwood floor. Not good for working out. They also have little to no grip of the soles, which again is not ideal.

These shoes were so cheap, yet they lasted for like six months and were comfy the whole time! I wasn't expecting shoes this cheap to last,  but they did. And I was using these everyday, walking around campus for hours on end.

I use these for running on concrete, mainly, in the city. They're comfortable and sturdy, and the color is really nice. They would probably be too heavy for speed running or marathons, but for 4-5 mile runs they're perfect.

Good fit, comfortable, light yet sturdy. Wore them four the first time at a University of Cincinnati basket ball game in Orlando Fluoride. Where the "CATS", lost to the University of Central Florida, once of only 5 games lost in the 2016/2017 season! The BlackBerry shoe withe red laces matched the team colors of the Cincinnati Bearcats!!! Love these shoes, and priced very well!

title: Reebok Womens Club C 85 Vintage Tennis Sneakers for Women, Casual White Womens Shoes
Customer_say: Customers find these tennis sneakers cute, comfortable, and well-made, appreciating their versatility as they go with many outfits. Customers consider them good value for money. The fit and size receive mixed feedback - while some say they're true to size, others find them too narrow. The arch support is also mixed, with several customers noting it lacks support.

Review.review: Comfortable, vintage style, teenager girl approved

My favorite shoe of ever I have bought this shoe for literally five years straight a new pair probably every 5 months I just love the way they look and lowkey wear out because there’s not a lot of foot support but they’re just so cute and go with everything

I recently purchased the Reebok Women’s Club C 85 Vintage Walking Shoe and couldn’t be happier. These shoes offer excellent cushioning and support, making them comfortable for long walks and daily wear.The vintage design is stylish and pairs well with almost any outfit. They fit true to size (normally size 8; ordered size 8) and feel great all day long.Overall, I highly recommend these shoes for anyone seeking a stylish, comfortable, and versatile sneaker. They have exceeded my expectations!

My favorite white sneakers so comfortable and have held up through rain and other extremes. These are my second pair and I love them so much! They crease easily but I don’t mind. Not the best walking shoes but they’re doable for mediumish distances. They’re pretty flat shoes so if you’re looking for ankle support, try another shoe! I love these and will continue to buy them.

I have wanted these shoes for over a year, but couldn't justify spending the cash. However, when I saw they'd dropped like $20, I went for it. I was nervous that they wouldnt fit my feet given the reviews and even considered buying two sizes/sizing up - I'm glad I didnt. I am a size 8, but sometimes wear a 7.5 in larger shoes i.e. Merrells. In New Balances, I can wear either a 7.5 or 8 usually. I wear an 8 in tevas/old navy flip flops. This shoe is definitely narrow, but I have narrow feet! I actually tried an 8.5 on in person to see if I should size up and let me tell you - I had clown feet. The 8.5 was creepily long on me. So I ordered the size 8 here and they fit perfectly! They're the perfect length for my feet and I actually have a little bit of wiggle room around my ankles so they're easy to slip on and off w/out messing up i.e., crushing the back of the shoe or having to untie them. Longer shoe laces would be nice, but thats something I could get on my own. These shoes don't provide much arch support, but they're comfy for walking around and running errands/being on campus for the day. They do rub a little on the back ankle if you're wearing shorter socks so beware of that - I just wear ankle socks now.This is a super detailed review, but I wanted to actually give some pointers instead of labeling these as good/bad.
I love these sneakers. Trendy throwback with comfort and style. True to size, looks good with jeans, sweats and joggers. I wear them a lot, great price and quality. Highly recommend.
Great looking but too narrow and short. I'm going to size up and see if they work because I do like the look.
They came in the original box and were super cute with every outfit! They fit true to size and are great quality and easy to clean! Would recommend for a daily casual shoe especially for the price!

title: Reebok Womens DMX Comfort + Slip-on
Customer_say: Customers find these sneakers extremely comfortable, excellent for walking, and appreciate their color and style. They are lightweight and provide good support, with one customer noting the cushioning moves with the foot. Customers consider them good value for money. The fit receives mixed feedback - while some find them a great fit, others mention they run narrow and are not suitable for wide feet.

Review.review: It was really important to me to have some comfortable shoes to workout in, but other shoes that are similar to these are extremely expensive. Since I am already familiar with the Reebok brand, I thought I would give these a try. I really like these shoes because they are not pricey and the DMX Comfort + sneakers in Chalk White/Purple are very pretty! These shoes have been great for me as I'm trying to incorporate more walking and exercise into my daily routine. My walks around the neighborhood and workouts on the treadmill and exercise bike are much more enjoyable because they provide the perfect combination of comfort and support. In addition, the sleek design and vibrant colors make these sneakers a fashion statement. They are a great option for anyone looking for a comfortable and stylish workout shoe.

I bought these for my daughter and she loves them! A great fit, very comfortable and very lightweight! She wears them all the time and loves the color! She highly recommends these shoes to anyone who wants durability, stylish, true to size and so comfortable!😀

I have many years of buying shoes of all kinds.  I have a very standard size 10 shoe.  I have often had heel spurs, arch support problems, etc.  I purchased the bright-ish orangie color for 29.98 while on a Today show special.  I got to admit, I did not have much hope that these would be any different than the other 20 pairs of tennis shoes sitting in my closet in various stages of use BUT... they are. These are THE MOST COMFORTABLE pair of walking shoes I have ever had.  EVER.  I bought another pair today before writing this review.  The shoes are light and airy, and extremely comfortable on the first day!!  Hope your experience will be the same!

These are very very comfortable and fit to size. I was looking for good women's walking sneakers. These were recommended on a women's health site. They are light weight and well cushioned. My only caution and the reason for 4 instead of 5 stars is this.  The sides of the tongue are sewn onto the body of the sneaker so the opening is a little narrow and can't be expanded when you slide you foot in.  I think this would be a problem if you have a wide foot.  I have a more narrow foot so they are perfect for me.  The black sneakers were 1/2 the price of the other colors so they were a great value for me.

I ordered these prior to going on a weeklong trip abroad where I’d be walking a lot. I logged about 10 miles per day and these shoes were great for my knees. I was mostly walking on sidewalks/paved areas, but a couple days were on dirt trails and the shoes were still great. I ordered my usual size (9.5) and they fit well length-wise. As other reviews stated, they were a bit tight on the sides, but I broke them in after the first day (it wasn’t difficult and I didn’t have any foot pain). I’d recommend them!
Cute, simple, and comfy. I've had them for several months at this point. I have high arches and these support very well. Great buy especially for the cost.

What sold me on these shoes was the non slip bottoms and the the stay dry ability.  They are heavier than my other shoes but not as heavy as some others.  Good arc support as I get plantar fasciitis easy.  I think I ordered up a half size and that was perfect. I have a messed up knee on the right side so these shoes do help with the compensation on the left.  Great Prime Day purchase. Recommend if you need a supportive shoe.Update:  What I loved about the shoes I now dislike.  They cause me more foot /heal pain the longer I wear them. I cannot wear them for extended periods.
These are a tight fit so if you have wide feet, these won’t be for you. Other than that these are great! Super lightweight, durable & easy to clean..

So, I never actually ran in these, but all I had to do is try them on to feel how tight/narrow they are. They look awesome, look/feel fast and I wanted them to be more comfortable, but I need a larger toe box.

This is my second pair of these shoes.  They are of great quality and great price.  The amount of technology in the shoe is worth the price.  Cushion and bounce back are very comfortable.  Great for short or long distances.

This Shoe is fantastic when it comes to comfortableness, like you are walking on Billows, yet it has one issue, it's not true to the size, I always wear 13 and it loose for me where I enjoy space while this one is a bit tide and long toes don't enjoy enough room as usual with any 13 Reebok I had or have now.

After running less than 50 miles, there was a chunk missing from one of the soles and they starting splitting/fraying elsewhere. I will probably try another pair because I’ve had difficulty finding running shoes that support my arches (even with high arch insoles) but don’t have high hopes.
This is a good, comfortable, lightweight, durable shoe. Great value. Good vendor. Fast delivery.

Love my Reeboks! I've been wearing Reeboks for 30+ years because of their fit, look and comfort. These are no exception. These have really good support and are great for working out or just daily wear. This particular shoe runs small by half a size. I ordered a half size larger than what I normally wear to get a little extra room, but they are no bigger, in fact, the size 8.5 I received is the exact length of the size 8 I had been wearing.

My husband love it!  The quality style support, everything is perfect.

Diseño resistente: están construidas con materiales duraderos que resisten el desgaste por lo que veo pero no le he dado tanto uso como para asegurar eso, hasta el momento todo OK, ofrecen una buena protección en terrenos variados.Versatilidad: Estas zapatillas están diseñadas para adaptarse a diferentes tipos de entrenamiento, desde levantamiento de pesas y ejercicio cardiovascular hasta actividades al aire libre. Brindan un buen equilibrio entre estabilidad y flexibilidad, permitiendo movimientos ágiles y proporcionando soporte para los pies en diversas actividades.Amortiguación y comodidad: Las Nano X2 Tr Adventure ofrecen una amortiguación adecuada para absorber el impacto durante actividades de alto impacto, brindando comodidad adicional a los pies, pero si eres de tener empeine alto no se que tan bueno sea el ajuste, diría que esta zapatilla no esta hecha para personas con el empeine alto. Además, cuentan con una plantilla acolchada que ofrece una sensación de suavidad y soporte adicional durante el uso prolongado.Agarre y tracción: La suela de goma de estas zapatillas está diseñada para proporcionar un buen agarre y tracción en diferentes superficies, incluyendo terrenos irregulares y resbaladizos. Esto es especialmente útil si planeas utilizarlas en actividades al aire libre, como caminatas o senderismo ligero.Estilo y apariencia: Las Reebok Men's Nano X2 Tr Adventure tienen un diseño atractivo y moderno, con opciones de colores llamativos. que al que le guste llamar la atencion, seguro que lo hara con unas de estas zapatillas. Esto las convierte en una opción versátil tanto para el entrenamiento como para el uso casual, permitiendo combinarlas con diferentes conjuntos de ropa.En resumen: muy buena zapatillas si pagas el precio correcto.
Cannot beat the price. These shoes look great and fit well. They have a wider toe and are breathable. Very flexible and easy to wear.

These are very comfortable, light weight, and really hold your foot in securely. I wore these to walk Augusta national and they didn’t disappoint. Roughly 20,000 steps later and my feet were still comfortable. They breathe very well and don’t make your feet sweat like crazy. So far they are holding up well and seem to be very durable.

Review.review: I actually bought these shoes for my nine year old son.  He absolutely loves them!  I do worry about the color getting dirty, but so far they haven't been any worse than could be expected from a boy who plays outside all the time. If that changes, I'll be sure to update this review.  But as for now, it's great to see them holding up, and a little water has washed off any dirt.  My son even swears he runs faster in them!
these shoes ripped near the stiches with in 2 days of wearing them and my 8 year old was so disappointed.Totally unsatisfied as we did not expect this from reebok.

Got these shoes at a fantastic price!  I normally get my son a half a size up to accommodate growth, so I ordered a 5.5 in a big kids size.  These fit more like a WHOLE size larger than a half size.  So my advice is to get your normal size if you normally size up.  I am happy with my purchase, however, and I like the quality of this shoe.  It is super lightweight and seems well made.  My son is hard on shoes, so we shall see how well they hold up.

Bought these for my 5 yr old and he loves them, they are a really nice shoe! but Reebok to me seem to run a little narrow, which is ok since my child has a narrow foot but you will need to get a Wide if your child's foot is wider. I got the size 11 and they fit him great...not any room to grow in but fit him in the size he is in right now great.

Supper cute my son loved them they are light and bendable, hasn't worn them yet though because I ordered them one size bigger just in case so he will be wearing them once he grows out of all his old ones.

I'm giving 2 stars for initial fit and style only. But ZERO stars for durability. Unfortunately my son has only worn these shoes less than 30 days and the tread at the bottom is peeling off. At the bottom of the shoe there is black rubber woven into the yellow sole; this is what is peeling apart from the shoe. In addition, these are not his only shoes he wears so he hasn't even given them heavy use.
After I used this shoes for a month, they become very smelly. I did washed them twice and had to get ride of them. Waste of money.
